means: 不可避免地，自然而然地

sentence.Network_en: Most modern housing estates are terrible and inevitably done on the cheap.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在的房子大多质量差劲透顶，肯定都是偷工减料盖起来的。

sentence.Network_en: Such a policy would inevitably draw fierce resistance from farmers.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种政策必然会招致农场主的强烈抵制。

sentence.Network_en: The rationale of reprocessing spent nuclear fuel is inevitably being questioned.
sentence.Network_cn: 对核废料进行再加工的理由不可避免地受到了质疑。

list.abs: Continental Crust is the inevitable product of formation and evolution of the Earth ., 大陆地壳是地球形成演化的必然产物.
(2)难免流产(inevitable abortion)：是先兆流产的继续，妊娠难以持续，有流产的临床过程，阴道出血时间较长，出血量较多，而且有 …
3. 不可避免性流产(Inevitable abortion)：子宫颈已扩张，阴道大量出血，持续子宫收缩，由于情况已严重到一定会流产，故称不可避 …
必然的英文翻译，必然用英语怎么说 -... ... 必然会 be destined to 必然趋势 inevitable trend 必然性 inevitability.
the inevitable result of social development ., 社会发展的必然结果.

entry.tran: 不可避免地;必然(发生)地
entry.def: If something will inevitably happen, it is certain to happen and cannot be prevented or avoided.

example.ex: Technological changes will inevitably lead to unemployment...
example.tran: 技术变革必然会导致失业。

example.ex: Inevitably, the proposal is running into difficulties.
example.tran: 提案不可避免地遭遇了麻烦。

means.word_mean: 1. in such a manner as could not be otherwise;

sentences.sentence: "the new council was inescapably of political meaning"

auth_sentence.content: Inevitably, the word picked up an abusive taint.
auth_sentence.res_content: Inevitably, the word picked up an abusive taint.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Inevitably, the word picked up an abusive taint.

auth_sentence.content: It seems to me that they must, inevitably.
auth_sentence.res_content: It seems to me that they must, inevitably.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It seems to me that they must, inevitably.

auth_sentence.content: But it does not lead inevitably to social disintegration.
auth_sentence.res_content: But it does not lead inevitably to social disintegration.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But it does not lead inevitably to social disintegration.

Sentence.sentence: Of the produce that does appear in the supermarket, commonly used sales promotions frequently encourage customers to purchase excessive quantities which, in the case of perishable foodstuffs, inevitably generate wastage in the home.
Town meetings called to discuss the problem inevitably dissolved into confrontations.
Inevitably however, the day came when she was so weakened that she had to return to Pittsburgh, her home town

sentences.en: In the way you go on,you are inevitably coming apart.
sentences.cn: 照你们这样下去,毫无疑问是会散伙的。

sentences.en: Industrialization inevitably led to the expansion of the urban working class.
sentences.cn: 工业化不可避免地道致了城市工人阶级人数的增多。

sentences.en: Inevitably,a quarrel followed between the two sides.
sentences.cn: 双方随后不可避免地争吵起来。
